title: Inventory Photo Manager
description: Built a web app for uploading and organizing product imagery across inventory items for operations teams.
overview: Laravel-based workflow that lets users upload, tag, and associate images with specific SKUs so warehouse and sales teams always see the latest visuals.
challenges: Ensuring consistent naming and SKU mapping across thousands of items
Keeping uploads performant while validating image size and format
Providing access controls so only authorized teams can edit product assets
Maintaining audit history for uploads and updates
solution: Implemented Laravel controllers & Form Requests for validated uploads, tagging, and SKU association
Blade-based UI with drag-and-drop upload, previews, and bulk tagging
Stored metadata in MySQL with constraints to prevent orphaned records
Policies & middleware for access control
results: Cut image lookup time for sales reps from minutes to seconds
Improved asset accuracy by enforcing validation and audit trails
Enabled non-technical users to manage imagery without engineering help

title: GPS Tracking Dashboard
description: Delivered a dashboard to monitor van sales routes in near real-time for field operations visibility.
overview: Laravel-backed API aggregates location pings and sales events into a single view so dispatchers can track routes, stops, and coverage.
challenges: Normalizing GPS data from different mobile devices and formats
Rendering live route updates without overwhelming the browser
Providing filters for territory, driver, and time windows
Keeping data fresh while limiting backend load
solution: Laravel API Resources to serve location and route summaries with pagination
Blade/JS front-end with map overlays and route playback
Server-side caching for high-volume pings and filtered queries
Role-based views so sales, dispatch, and management see tailored data
results: Gave operations real-time visibility into daily routes and delays
Reduced support requests from field teams by surfacing self-serve data
Improved on-time deliveries by enabling proactive rerouting

title: Invoice Workflow Tracker
description: Developing a workflow app to track physical invoices from print to processing and document upload.
overview: Laravel models each invoice state, tracks handoffs in the warehouse, and records when documents are uploaded for credit processing.
challenges: Designing clear state transitions and preventing duplicate processing
Ensuring auditability for compliance and credit checks
Keeping the UI responsive while syncing status updates
Integrating with existing document repository
solution: Laravel Eloquent models with explicit workflow states and guards
Persisted invoice history in MySQL with audit tables for traceability
REST endpoints consumed by a lightweight JS front-end for real-time status
results: Centralized visibility into invoice lifecycle for warehouse and finance
Reduced duplicate handling by enforcing stateful workflows
Improved processing readiness by surfacing blockers earlier

title: Legacy User Service Migration
description: Migrated a legacy user service to Spring Boot on Java 17, improving performance and reducing technical debt.
overview: Rebuilt the service with modern Spring Boot patterns, tightened data access, and introduced caching for faster responses.
challenges: Untangling tightly coupled legacy code and brittle SQL
Reducing database load from inefficient queries
Ensuring zero regression for downstream consumers
Establishing CI/CD for the modernized service
solution: Implemented Spring Boot (Java 17) service with layered architecture and DTO mapping
Optimized SQL queries and added indices to cut response times
Added caching for frequent reads and contract tests for API consumers
Update Jenkins pipelines for consistent deployments
results: Improved response times and stability for user-facing endpoints
Reduced production defects tied to the legacy service
Lowered operational overhead with automated builds and releases

title: Data Quality & Insights
description: Performed SQL-driven data analysis to clean, organize, and validate large datasets for banking stakeholders.
overview: Partnered with data governance teams to improve accuracy and reporting efficiency by standardizing queries and validations.
challenges: Identifying inconsistencies across multiple source systems
Improving data quality without interrupting reporting timelines
Documenting transformations for audit and handoff
Aligning stakeholders on validated metrics
solution: Wrote advanced SQL to cleanse, deduplicate, and validate key datasets
Produced reusable scripts and views to standardize reporting
Documented data lineage and validation steps for governance
Shared insights with business units to guide remediation
results: Improved data accuracy and reliability for downstream reports
Reduced manual cleanup by templating repeatable SQL workflows
Enabled faster decision-making with cleaner, trusted data

title: Lunch Management Application
description: Web app to manage daily lunch orders, menus, and pickups with role-based access for staff and admins.
overview: Built a fullstack solution to streamline lunch ordering: employees browse daily menus, place or edit orders before cutoff, and admins manage menus, inventory, and pickup reports.
challenges: Coordinating order cutoffs and preventing late submissions
Avoiding double orders and handling edits/cancellations cleanly
Generating accurate pickup summaries for vendors
Providing a responsive UI for mobile users
solution: Laravel REST API with validation (Form Requests) and time-based guards for order windows
Relational schema in MySQL with constraints to prevent duplicates
Blade/JS UI with clear states for open/closed ordering and real-time feedback
results: Reduced manual tracking and errors in daily orders
Improved vendor coordination through exportable pickup summaries
Increased adoption due to fast, mobile-friendly interface
